question: pregnancy tests are negative but am still having pregnancy symptoms. why?
answer: Birth control pills come in a pack of 21 or 21 active plus seven dummy pills or the single dose of an emergency contraceptive pill. If you have pcod (polycystic ovarian disease) or obesity, have the same oral combined birth control pill (21 pills) twice a day for ten days and throw away the last pill. From the first day of the bleeding, have the next packet of 21 pills once at night for 21 days and continue the same 21 pills packet to regularize periods until you shed some weight. If you forget to take the pill in between or take it haphazardly, your natural cycle is out of the track but it can be corrected by getting a urine pregnancy test done.

question: am i under correct medication for my symptoms? is it gerd?
answer: I will give you recommendations for treating suspected gastroesophageal reflux disease (acid reflux disease). Try eating more slowly, avoiding spicy foods, chewing non-mint type chewing gum, lying flat after eating, sitting up for two hours after finishing a meal, and light walking for 15 to 30 minutes following a meal. Additionally, an endoscopy procedure called gastroscopy is recommended to check for any weakness in the valve at the lower end of the food pipe and to visualize any evidence of inflammation there. Finally, a 24 hour ph monitoring study and a manometry test are recommended to confirm that acid is refluxing back whenever you have symptoms and that there is no problem with motility of the gullet.

question: my teeth are yellow. is scaling only a temporary process to clean the teeth?
answer: Yellowing of teeth is mainly due to tartar or plaque deposits, which can lead to tooth decay and cavities. The lower incisors and canines are more prone to plaque and calculus deposition due to inability to reach the inner sides of these teeth while brushing. To prevent this, the head of the toothbrush should be angulated in such a way that it reaches all the teeth and all the interior and hidden parts of the teeth, crowding of teeth (due to inadequate spacing in between the teeth), and use specific tooth brushes (orthodontic toothbrushes) to clean the teeth thoroughly.
